dc:description: TCOF1 was reported in relation to Treacher Collins syndrome (TCS) in 1996 (Gladwin et al., 8894686). At least 12 unique variants (nonsense, frameshift, and splicing) have been reported in humans. Evidence supporting this gene-disease relationship includes case-level data, segregation data, and experimental data. Variants in this gene have been reported in at least 13 probands in 6 publications (22317976, 29230583, 31307516, 8894686, 25790162, 30390570). Variants in this gene segregated in 9 additional family members. More evidence is available in the literature, but the maximum score for genetic evidence and experimental evidence (12 pts.) has been reached. The mechanism of disease is haploinsufficiency. This gene-disease association is supported by animal models and expression studies. In summary, TCOF1 is definitively associated with autosomal dominant Treacher Collins syndrome.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 21
evidence.detectionMethod: Patients with Treacher Collins Syndrome were screened successively for TCOF1, POLR1D, POLR1C, and EFTUD2 using Sanger, multiplex ligation-dependent probe amplification analysis, array-comparative genomic hybridization, and denaturing high-pressure liquid chromatography.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Downward-slating palpebral fissures, malar hypoplasia, conductive deafness, mandibular hypoplasia, microtia

evidence.dc:description: Only the TCOF1 gene was analyzed for dosage and sequence (POLR1D & POLR1C not looked at).

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 263
evidence.detectionMethod: The 27 coding exons were amplified in 28 fragments and sequenced using BigDye 3.1 chemistry (Applied Biosystems). Mutation Surveyor software was used to identify sequence variants.

evidence.dc:description: Paternity/maternity confirmation is not present. Only the TCOF1 gene was analyzed for dosage and sequence (POLR1D & POLR1C not looked at).

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 261
evidence.detectionMethod: The 27 coding exons were amplified in 28 fragments and sequenced using BigDye 3.1 chemistry (Applied Biosystems). Mutation Surveyor software was used to identify sequence variants.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: bilateral microtia, Treacher Collins sydrome diagnosis

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient S15P
evidence.detectionMethod: The coding of exons and exon–intron boundaries of TCOF1 (NM_001135243.1), POLR1D (NM_015972.3) and POLR1C (NM_203290.2) genes were amplified and were subjected to Sanger sequencing. They were genotyped using the HumanOmni1-Quad v1.0 beadchip (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA) on an Illumina Iscan System according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The PennCNV algorithm was employed to infer copy number variations (CNVs) from signal intensity data.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Maxillofacial dysplasia, downslating palpebral fissures, lower eyelid colobama, microtia (III on Marx classification), external ear canal stenosis, severe hearing loss (type not reported)

evidence.dc:description: Confirmed de novo but no paternity/maternity information

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 7
evidence.detectionMethod: Patients with Treacher Collins Syndrome were screened successively for TCOF1, POLR1D, POLR1C, and EFTUD2 using Sanger, multiplex ligation-dependent probe amplification analysis, array-comparative genomic hybridization, and denaturing high-pressure liquir chromatography.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Downward-slating palpebral fissures, malar hypoplasia, conductive deafness, mandibular hypoplasia

evidence.dc:description: Only the TCOF1 gene was analyzed for dosage and sequence (POLR1D & POLR1C not looked at). Corresponding author of paper mentioned: " father and son both carry the mutation but neither had any strong clinical features and appeared unaffected (we tested father originally as he was an obligate carrier but I have no info on other affected family members)." Because no clear phenotype was observed, I downgraded to 0 points.

evidence.rdfs:label: XE3286
evidence.detectionMethod: WES was performed and an average sequencing depth of 100-fold and 97.7% coverage was reported. Enriched shotgun libraries were sequenced on a HiseqX platform (Illumina). Reads were aligned to human reference sequence (hg19) using Burrows-Wheeler Aligner. Genotypes called using SAMtools, Picard, and GATK. SNVs annotated using ANNOVAR software. Sanger sequencing was performed to confirm mutations that were identified in TCOF1.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: downward slanting palpebral fissures, lower eyelid coloboma, zygomatic hypoplasia, mandibular hypoplasia, conductive hearing loss, delayed speech development

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient 13
evidence.detectionMethod: Patients with Treacher Collins Syndrome were screened successively for TCOF1, POLR1D, POLR1C, and EFTUD2 using Sanger, multiplex ligation-dependent probe amplification analysis, array-comparative genomic hybridization, and denaturing high-pressure liquir chromatography.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Downward-slating palpebral fissures, malar hypoplasia, conductive deafness, mandibular hypoplasia, microtia

evidence.dc:description: Downgraded because hearing loss phenotype of the proband was not clearly stated and the sequencing methods are older.

evidence.rdfs:label: Proband Individual 5
evidence.detectionMethod: The cosmid clones were digested with Sau3A1 or AluI and cloned into M13mp18. Recombinant plaques were plated and screened with end-labeled oligonucleotides designed from the sequence of the exons. The single-stranded DNA from the positive plaques was sequenced using dideoxy chain termination sequencing using Sequenase version 2.0, and the data were compared with published cDNA sequence and intron-exon boundaries. Single-stranded conformation polymorphism anlaysis was used and if the results showed a mobility shift, PCR of the coding exon and flanking intronic regions was performed. Mutations were confirmed by PCR then digestion with BsrI, PmlI, or StyI and the fragments were run on polyacrylamide gels and hybridized with allele-specific oligonucleotides.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Abnormalities of external ears with atresia of external auditory canals and anomalies of the middle ear ossicles (bilateral hearing loss), hypoplasia of facial bones, downward slanting of palpebral fissures with colobomas of the lower eyelids and paucity of lid lashes medial to the defect, cleft palate

evidence.rdfs:label: P5
evidence.detectionMethod: 52 genes associated with 35 different syndromes inlcuding GJB2 were selected and primers were designed to cover these genes. Targets massively parallel sequencing was used and variants were called by the Ion Reporter, the Genome Analyzer Toolkit (GATK) Haplotype Caller and SamTools (mpileup).
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: zygomatic arch hypoplasia, microtia, cleft palate, conductive hearing loss

evidence.rdfs:label: Gladwin Family 14
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Abnormalities of external ears with atresia of external auditory canals and anomalies of the middle ear ossicles (bilateral hearing loss), hypoplasia of facial bones, downward slanting of palpebral fissures with colobomas of the lower eyelids and paucity of lid lashes medial to the defect, cleft palate

evidence.rdfs:label: Family SP19

evidence.dc:description: Mutant mice exhibit normal inner ear development, conductive hearing loss. The residual mesenchyme in middle ear spaces have linked to incidences of CHL in humans. The asymmetric hearing loss phenotype was seen in 30% of mutant mice and in 50% of humans with Treacher Collins syndrome patients.
evidence.rdfs:label: TCOF1 Mutant Mouse Model

evidence.dc:description: RT-PCR showed decreased transcription of TCOF-1 in leukocytes and mesenchymal cell samples from patients with Treacher Collins syndrome.
evidence.rdfs:label: RT-PCR of TCOF1 in TCS Patients
